column1:
## Reason of admission
69 years old man who came in on the 2024-01-08 with a bit swollen right leg since three days. Patient noticed progress of swelling and appearance of redness on day 3. Temp 38 degrees Celsius. 

## Medical history
Hypertension, diabetes mellitus type 2, chronic kidney disease stage 3

## Hospital course
On examination not so swollen right leg, not so defined redness and a little pain when palpated. CRP 179. Leukocytes 12,2. P-Creatinine 137. Started Fenoximetylpenicillin 1 gram x 3 per os for suspected erysipelas. To exclude the presence of deep vein thrombosis in the right leg the patient underwent an ultrasound examination which showed signs of DVT. Patient recieved oxynorm and was able to mobilise the leg. No fever. No pain. CRP 47, leukocytes normalized, P-crea 128. Ward nurse informed patients wife and planned for transporatation home on 2024-01-11. 

## Medications
    Amlodipin (Amlodipine), 5 mg 1+0+0
    Losartan (Losartan), 50 mg 1+0+0
    Metformin (Metformin), 500 mg 2+0+2
    KÃ¥vepenin (Phenoxymethylpenicillin),1g 1+1+1 until 19/1
    Eliquis (Apixaban),5mg 1+0+0, 3 months

## Procedures 
  None

## Plan after discharge
Antibiotics and oral anticoagulation treatment. No follow-up needed. 

## Secondary diagnosis
-     Hypertension
-     Diabetes mellitus type 2
-     Chronic kidney disease stage 3

## Main diagnosis (name and ICD code)
I80.2 Phlebitis and thrombophlebitis of other deep vessels of lower extremities
